If @POTUS can delay student debt repayment indefinitely, he can cancel it once and for all.

My latest for @DataProgress on new polling showing that the American people agree: it's time to #CancelStudentDebt ‚§µÔ∏è

While corporations and special interests consolidate obscene levels of power, @WorkingFamilies is fighting to ensure our country works for working people.

A lifelong civil rights activist, Hezekiah Easter, Jr. made history when he was elected to the Nyack Board of Trustees in 1965, becoming the first Black person ever elected to public office in Rockland County. https://t.co/jgEuOwRKNc

Horace Pippin was a prominent artist who called the Hudson Valley home for much of his life.

His vivid portrayals of Black life in the 1930s and 40s have inspired generations of Black artists and innovators. https://t.co/SC1QgK9IVz

Sandra Day O‚ÄôConnor once wrote that she learned from serving with Thurgood Marshall on the bench. The fact is, our legal system is better when we have judges who reflect the diverse lived experiences of all Americans.

It's past time we have a Black woman Supreme Court Justice. https://t.co/UYKOZR9XgY
The legal profession is broken. https://t.co/3rOMxVCdDL
The crazies have taken over. We can‚Äôt afford to look away. https://t.co/ZZ4pqTwT5z

This blatant antisemitism is disgusting.

Comparing the genocide of millions of Jews to your not being able to get a panini is as abhorrent as it is idiotic. Yet prominent Republicans keep doing it. https://t.co/5iALgRy1tR

I am horrified at the racist and bigoted language hurled at the Lakeland BOE. This kind of hatred and vitriol has no place in our society.

I cannot believe, in the state of New York in the year 2022, that this needs to be said.
https://t.co/9lrIWprxbt

I‚Äôm proud to be one of them.

And I‚Äôm proud to be part of the majority of Americans who support expanding the Supreme Court to protect that sacred right. https://t.co/n8oBkzF7jQ

It's time, @POTUS. https://t.co/o8zCDiedic

Health care is a human right, and I'm committed to ensuring that all of our communities - rural, urban, or otherwise - get the high-quality care they deserve. https://t.co/QOt4ZHxhy0

This is the question my colleagues and I are asking @TheJusticeDept to answer. The time to act is now. https://t.co/VnGIAeBTpn

Long before he became the first Black Supreme Court Justice, Thurgood Marshall helped to integrate schools in #NY17 as a lawyer with the NAACP.

He laid the groundwork for generations of Black history-makers like me to follow in his footsteps. https://t.co/nIQ9nkCAWq
@RubenGallego Happy Birthday @Syd_Gallego!

I was honored to visit @PortJervisNY on Saturday. Thanks to Mayor Kelly Decker, Dick Roberts and the local Democratic Committee, and @SparrowTobin and area labor leaders for speaking with me about the challenges our communities face. I can't wait to get to work for the new #NY17. https://t.co/k2s8SgYOq1
That their careers outlived yours. https://t.co/FkWZ0LKNn5

Alfreda Williams made history as the first-ever Black Town Clerk in Greenburgh, and went on to serve for more than a decade as a Westchester County Legislator.

I‚Äôm so grateful for all she‚Äôs done for Westchester and the Hudson Valley. https://t.co/otnce8DpYa

Yesterday, I visited Eve and @ChrisPawelski, the fourth-generation owners of Pawelski Farms. We discussed his family history and the issues facing family farmers in the black dirt region of Orange County. https://t.co/iyBh6uAQUB

I had a great time in beautiful Warwick this weekend with Town Supervisor Mike Sweeton. We talked about the rich history of Warwick and his vision for its future. We also toured the urbanXtracts cannabis testing facility. This will be a boon for the local economy. https://t.co/CwynJ46wHi

I was raised by a single mom who worked multiple jobs just to make ends meet.

Universal child care, paid leave, and an expanded #ChildTaxCredit would have been life-changing for our family, which is why I'll keep fighting to #BuildBackBetter.
https://t.co/dII7pll5MM

This is evil. LGBTQ+ youth have enough to worry about without opportunists like @RonDeSantisFL politicizing their very existence.

To the LGBTQ+ youth in Florida, and everywhere: you are seen, you are loved, and there are so many people rooting and fighting for you. https://t.co/j5qutfuSvB

Our democracy is in crisis.

It's time for @thejusticedept to act like it and do everything in its power to protect the sacred right to vote.
https://t.co/IALnOKhPqD

‚ÄúWhat happened Monday night was a raw power play by a runaway majority that seems to recognize no stopping point.‚Äù https://t.co/OOigou7EHx
The same Republicans who call the violent attack on the Capitol "legitimate political discourse" are hellbent on outlawing books they disagree with and suppressing the right to vote.

Weird to see POLITICO publish an article stating that one SCOTUS candidate has ‚Äúthe highest ceiling for GOP support‚Äù and then cite as evidence a GOP Senator who just voted to confirm a different SCOTUS candidate a few months ago.

Yikes. https://t.co/G9HQLFrVYw

Like me, @JulianCastro knows that policy is personal.

I'm excited to join him for a conversation about economic justice, the importance of representation, and why the best policies are those informed by lived experience.

Join us ‚§µ https://t.co/810iiGO37G

Watching people tie themselves into knots to avoid calling for Court expansion.

Remember that Congress passed the original Voting Rights Act. This Supreme Court simply doesn‚Äôt care.

Gross. https://t.co/Z5bY23jwVa

But that‚Äôs the exception. That‚Äôs why we need to allow congressional staff to unionize. 

Let‚Äôs do this. https://t.co/sQ3TPcVz0o

Student debt cancellation is a racial justice issue, and Black History Month is the perfect time for @POTUS to #CancelStudentDebt.

He wouldn't know judicial independence if it hit him in the face. https://t.co/AZiL1cfcpK

.@Livableworld is on the frontlines fighting for a world with fewer nuclear weapons and less war, and I‚Äôm thrilled to have their support in my re-election campaign. 

Together, we‚Äôll build a world that is livable for generations to come. https://t.co/QSortJn92C

60 years ago, Congress voted to pass the 24th Amendment to end the poll tax. 

Does anyone really think we could get 10 Republican Senators to vote for the 24th Amendment today?

The crises we face demand bold, structural changes - from Court expansion to Medicare for All.

@DFAaction's leadership is vital in creating the change this moment demands. I'm proud to call them partners and honored to have their endorsement. https://t.co/SLAmNOVcBq

The people banning books on slavery and the Holocaust from schools now want the benefit of the doubt when it comes to voter suppression.

Nah.
He doesn't need Congress. He could #CancelStudentDebt today with the stroke of a pen. https://t.co/QvaG4RFf2Y

I was 11 years old when Columbine occurred. I never imagined mass shootings in America would become the norm.

Anyone still opposing common-sense gun safety legislation in the year 2022 has blood on their hands.
https://t.co/1jfpdjzRkd

Never in our nation's history has a Black woman served on the Supreme Court. It's long past time we change that. 

In his first year, @POTUS has shown a commitment to nominating jurists who reflect the diversity of America. We need him to extend that commitment to the High Court.
Still true. https://t.co/CKeo5IfctC
I felt this. https://t.co/qFTXHTC0N8

The usual obstructionist DINOs are attacking President Biden in the press this week, accusing him of trying to do too much for the American people.

The fact is, Build Back Better is fully paid for and popular with more than 60 percent of voters. Congress has a duty to deliver.

The project of representative government requires us to know where our Senators stand on civil rights and democracy. Thanks to Schumer‚Äôs insistence on a vote, we can more effectively organize to send better people to the Senate.

Anyone suggesting otherwise has DC brain rot. https://t.co/olY3mdg1J2

We've come too far in the fight for multiracial democracy to give up now.

Our work to protect the sacred right to vote must and will go on. So long as I have breath, I will keep fighting.
https://t.co/FWeBfPUStz
@mehdirhasan My favorite character.

Student debt isn't just a millennial issue. It's a crisis facing people young and old throughout our country.

There's no excuse for @POTUS not to use his power to cancel it.
This one‚Äôs my favorite. https://t.co/1btO6nBOLL

49 years after becoming law, Roe v. Wade is on the verge of being decimated by the far-right Supreme Court.

With the Court threatening to drag us back to the days of back-alley abortions, let's be clear: Court expansion is an issue of reproductive freedom. https://t.co/QHBVeweXXM

Last week, there were fake tears from Sinema. This week, Mitch is ‚Äúhurt.‚Äù

You know what‚Äôs more hurtful? Being denied the vote because you‚Äôre Black. https://t.co/1H7NwK9Wd8

It's been 12 years since the Supreme Court's disastrous Citizens United decision unleashed a torrent of dark money in our elections.

As our democracy falls deeper into crisis, it's more urgent than ever that we #ExpandTheCourt.

Yesterday, right-wing Twitter was offended that I described opponents of voting rights as white nationalists. (Racist people don‚Äôt like being called racist.)

Anyway, here‚Äôs the Senate Republican leader suggesting that Black people aren‚Äôt American. https://t.co/LOKX1wzwi5

John Lewis would be proud of this #GoodTrouble. 

I'm proud today, and every day, to call @JamaalBowmanNY my friend, my neighbor, and my colleague in our fight to protect the sacred right to vote. https://t.co/YfOMRrvgEL
The right to vote is preservative of every other right in our democracy. I‚Äôll never stop fighting to protect it.
1,876,478,364,976 reasons for @POTUS to #CancelStudentDebt. https://t.co/aStcWai7NW

I‚Äôm about to speak on the House floor about the Senate‚Äôs failure to protect multiracial democracy, and the path forward.

This fight is not over.

I want to commend @SenSchumer‚Äôs strong leadership on voting rights. It‚Äôs been an honor working with him. While the force of reason and weight of history didn‚Äôt convince 52 Senators, he was right to force a vote that allowed the world to see today‚Äôs opponents of civil rights.

In the 60s, they used dogs and billy clubs to deny us the ballot. Today, they hide behind procedure.

But there‚Äôs nothing our movement can‚Äôt overcome. I still believe Dr. King‚Äôs words that the arc of the moral universe bends towards justice. Maybe not today, but we will win this.

Senator Collins is lying again, and Senator Ossoff is right to call her out. If she supports the Voting Rights Act, as she claims, Lisa Murkowski would not have been the only Republican Senator who cosponsored the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act.
I thank God for the moral leadership of Senator Warnock, who is here for such a time as this. https://t.co/BsQQFoRGlo

There are 52 Senators opposing previously uncontroversial voting rights legislation right now, and some idiot reporters are asking the President whether it was civil to compare their efforts to those of other civil rights opponents.

Expanding the Supreme Court is essential to protecting our democracy, our country, and our fundamental human rights.

I sat down with @ASP to explain why now is the moment to #ExpandTheCourt. https://t.co/XKVkyz6bJb

It's decision day for our democracy as the Senate takes up the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act.

Every Senator must make a choice: do they stand with our democracy, or with the insurrectionists deadset on destroying it?

With stakes this high, there is no middle ground.
Proof that opposition to filibuster reform for voting rights was always about the character flaws of the Senators opposing it. https://t.co/DsFw4OhWtj

Good morning. Will Joe Manchin be more effective in blocking civil rights legislation than Robert Byrd?

Stay tuned.

In which the Senator from West Virginia states that protecting the right of Black and brown people to vote shouldn‚Äôt be a priority.

Disgusting. https://t.co/vmoMBtuyVN

McConnell‚Äôs gaslighting of voting rights legislation as ‚ÄúJim Crow‚Äù was bad enough. Then he falsely claimed that legislation to revive Secs. 2 and 4 of the Voting Rights Act have‚Äîwait for it‚Äînothing to do with the original Voting Rights Act. 

Why lie if there‚Äôs nothing to hide?

Amid the worst assault on the right to vote since Jim Crow, normalize the media describing the failure to pass voting rights legislation as a major setback for democracy rather than a setback for Democrats.
You never understood that legacy and are actively destroying it. https://t.co/c8ljnRzjEk

Dr. King dedicated his life to the promise of a true multiracial democracy. We have a once-in-a-generation opportunity to make that dream a reality, but time is running out.

The only proper way to honor his legacy is to pass voting rights legislation. https://t.co/D7DAAUrfmD

Tomorrow, deceitful politicians will post cherry-picked quotes from Dr. King while actively working to destroy his legacy.

Don't listen to them. If they're not protecting voting rights, they're on the side of Bull Connor and George Wallace.
Yes, it was the election of Barack Obama. https://t.co/X01VbOfYU6

If avid segregationists could be convinced to vote for the 1982 amendments to the Voting Rights Act, and Sens. Sinema and Manchin could vote for an exception to the filibuster one month ago, I believe they can be convinced to save our democracy.

There‚Äôs too much at stake. https://t.co/YynKLshRiy

Last week, Senator Sinema claimed that the real threat to our democracy is ‚Äúdivisions.‚Äù Arizonans know better. 

They know that divisions didn‚Äôt pass voter suppression laws in Arizona. Republicans did. Divisions didn‚Äôt try to overturn Arizona‚Äôs election results. Republicans did.

I‚Äôm horrified by the situation at Beth Israel Synagogue in Colleyville, TX. Sending all of my strength to those affected, and hoping for a safe resolution. 

Our nation must reckon with our crises of gun violence and antisemitism. Enough is enough.

Dr. King knew that power concedes nothing without a demand.

Today, I joined his family in Arizona to honor his legacy and demand every Democratic Senator, including Kyrsten Sinema, do what's right and #DeliverForVotingRights. https://t.co/XVBwgHdlJb

The time for voting rights legislation is NOW.
 
I'll be in Phoenix this weekend to honor the #MLKLegacy with @RubenGallego and the family of MLK and demand that the Senate pass the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act.

Join us ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/hYMaH3QRzU

In 2006, the Senate voted unanimously to reauthorize the Voting Rights Act.

16 years later, not a single Republican is willing to protect the right to vote.

If you‚Äôre a Democratic Senator still hiding behind the filibuster, then you don‚Äôt support multiracial democracy either.

Last year, the WH punted on expanding the Supreme Court‚Äîcreating a commission that was doomed to fail.

Yesterday, the Court‚Äôs far-right, anti-science majority struck down @POTUS‚Äô signature policy to keep us all safe.

I hope the WH has learned its lesson. Lives are on the line. https://t.co/fBjI3UXZ70

This is a rogue, anti-science Supreme Court. The far-right majority is risking the lives of millions of Americans to score cheap political points.

Expand the Court. https://t.co/gOVethnH0D

Reproductive freedom is a human right. But we can no longer rely on the Supreme Court to protect that right from unjust and unconstitutional attacks like this.

Pass the Women's Health Protection Act and #ExpandTheCourt.
https://t.co/nm7eksz4Qq

BIG NEWS: The Right to Vote Act, my bill to codify the sacred right to vote, just passed the House as part of the Freedom to Vote Act.

Now it heads to the Senate, where the only option is to reform the filibuster to save our democracy.
I get chills listening to my Republican colleagues describe voting rights legislation as a federal takeover of elections. The same argument was used to oppose the original Voting Rights Act.
Jim Crow goes too far. https://t.co/TEpMBrXjmt

One key new protection against election subversion in this legislation: my Right to Vote Act, the first-ever affirmative guarantee of the right to vote. My bill would protect the right to have your vote counted and certified‚Äîand empower you to secure that right in court. https://t.co/uMtRZsBDRJ
Arizona‚Äôs future Senator is talkingüëáüèø https://t.co/O29KYvLp7J
American democracy. https://t.co/xr04bIYxn3

Mitch McConnell is attacking President Biden for defending the right to vote. 

Where was this energy when Trump was defending violent white supremacists and bragging about sexually assaulting women? 

Mitch McConnell is the most partisan of hacks. Don‚Äôt listen to a word he says. https://t.co/gVNo7FIh5W
Like I said, it‚Äôs really just two Senators. https://t.co/Vg9LlSnNCy
Congratulations, Congresswoman. We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you to the People‚Äôs House. https://t.co/R3fJonamef
It is literally just Manchin and Sinema. https://t.co/ivuS2ePt0W

I wrote this op-ed seven months ago, and it's still every bit as true.

We can't accept half-measures when it comes to our democracy. The only way to meet this moment is to reform the filibuster to pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Act. https://t.co/0XfuWWTIrs

The people of Arizona should know that Senator Sinema is standing in the way of saving American democracy. 

I'm headed there on Saturday with the family of MLK, Jr. and groups like @IndivisibleTeam to organize and make it loud and clear. https://t.co/X9PauyHCy3

We‚Äôre just 10 days into 2022 and Big Pharma has raised the prices of nearly 600 prescription drugs.

The #BuildBackBetter Act would help end this price-gouging. It's time to get it done.

As Mayor of Long Beach, @RobertGarcia has taken bold climate action, fought for the rights of organized labor, and championed Medicare for All.

I know he'll bring that same progressive leadership to Congress, which is why I'm proud to endorse his campaign for #CA42. https://t.co/wn4Tc7pqjZ
It is impossible, watching the behavior of this Court. https://t.co/YHZ6EwcwsZ

Did you hear some of the questions posed during oral argument at the Supreme Court on Friday? The far-right majority would put millions of lives at risk because they believe the disinformation they hear on Fox ‚ÄúNews‚Äù about vaccines.

Our failure to #ExpandTheCourt is deadly. https://t.co/pBRWXtsHYH
@RubenGallego @allinwithchris It was amazing to see üòÇ

My heart breaks over the passing of my former professor, Lani Guinier. I will have more to say on the House floor next week, but here I will just note that she taught me everything I know about voting rights law. Now she joins the pantheon of great civil rights leaders in heaven. https://t.co/7EMSlTfWhH

It's been nearly a year since @POTUS ordered @usedgov to produce a memo on whether he has the power to cancel student debt.

Of course, we know he has the authority because he's already used it.

It's time to release the memo and #CancelStudentDebt.
BuT cAn‚ÄôT wE wAiT fOr TeRm LiMiTs To SeT iN ü•¥ https://t.co/iBOJpiImRM

This from the guy who refused to recognize Trump‚Äôs Islamophobic remarks as evidence of the animus behind the Muslim ban.

What the Republican President says is irrelevant, but what the Democratic Chief of Staff retweets is?

The partisanship is deafening. https://t.co/yagJhbhIEi

From fighting for a living wage to defending reproductive freedom to advancing meaningful policing reform, @GregCasar has been a progressive champion for the people of Texas.

We need more leaders like Greg in Congress, which is why I'm proud to endorse his campaign. https://t.co/ZSkhMqJX7f

This is cringe even for Ted Cruz. If you‚Äôre tempted to feel bad for him in this exchange, just remind yourself that he chooses to be part of this madness.

Every day, GOP members of Congress choose power over integrity. https://t.co/trnxWcsZpj

This is a favorite line in the GOP arsenal. ‚ÄúStop being so divisive,‚Äù said the white nationalist inciting violence at the Capitol and disenfranchising millions of Black and brown voters. https://t.co/FRtsRQCyPd

When you‚Äôre under the gun, and your life is flashing before your eyes, it‚Äôs amazing how friends can find strength in humor. 

‚ÄúOh, is this your first coup?‚Äù @RepColinAllred asked me once things got crazy on the House floor. https://t.co/0mTQGb9uFb

It‚Äôs been one year since violent insurrectionists - incited by Donald Trump and Republican members of Congress - nearly overthrew our government.

In the year since, our democracy has fallen deeper into crisis.

The Senate must act this month to pass sweeping democracy reforms.

Just days after the insurrection, I joined #WhatADay to discuss January 6th and the crisis facing our democracy.

One year later, I sat down with them again to discuss what‚Äôs changed in the last year, and the urgent need to save our democracy. 

Our full conversation ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/sJ9H49r4PL
@DrJasonJohnson üò©
.@HawleyMO, this you? https://t.co/kHX6yikFud https://t.co/1AieKXxGPj

BIG NEWS: The Progressive Caucus just endorsed our bill to expand the Supreme Court!

As the Court‚Äôs far-right majority assails our democracy and fundamental rights, the need for Court expansion has never been more urgent.

With @USProgressives, we can and will #ExpandTheCourt. https://t.co/d2OOmjux6p

The Big Lie that incited the January 6th insurrection and the decision of every House Republican to oppose the John Lewis Voting Rights Act are related.

The engine of GOP power is voter disenfranchisement. The Senate must reform the filibuster and protect the right to vote.

Reforming the Electoral Count Act is no substitute for robust voting rights legislation. And it‚Äôs no coincidence that limited GOP support for it as an alternative (rather than a supplement) has only materialized as Democrats prepare to reform Senate rules. We should do both. https://t.co/RqFVy50XfW
I‚Äôve been warning this for months. There will be no shame under a GOP majority. https://t.co/P2EB9HSSI2

As a candidate, @POTUS made a promise to #CancelStudentDebt.

With the stroke of a pen, he has the power to make good on his promise and strengthen our economy.

The American people are waiting. https://t.co/BNcKIURoIX
Our democracy is in crisis. Abolish the filibuster and pass the Freedom to Vote Act.
The spousal privilege against testifying will get people married almost overnight. https://t.co/J3rLUmV8k9

One year ago today, I was sworn into Congress as the Representative for #NY17. A year later, it remains the honor of my life to represent the community that raised me.

I'm looking forward to making more good trouble on behalf of Westchester and Rockland in the year ahead.

I know it‚Äôs tempting to call Erick an idiot, but what he‚Äôs doing is more sinister. Across the country, the far-right is minimizing the attempted overthrow of the federal government to allow another opportunity to seize control this fall through voter disenfranchisement. https://t.co/9REksjbtZC

Last year was tough, but the great people of Haiti persevered as they always do. May this new year be filled with more joy and less hardship.

I wish the people of Haiti, and my Haitian constituents, a very happy Haitian Independence Day.

I had a wonderful time celebrating Peekskill‚Äôs first Black woman mayor, Vivian McKenzie, and swearing in my friend Ramon Fernandez to the Peekskill Common Council today. I look forward to continuing to work closely with the city‚Äôs new leadership in the years to come. https://t.co/QkxgShyZPC

This year, I'm looking forward to protecting the right to vote, continuing our work to Build Back Better, and electing Democrats up and down the ballot.

What are you looking forward to in 2022?

Budgets are statements of our values.

If we can afford to increase the military budget after ending our longest war, we can afford to ensure every American can live in dignity.
https://t.co/DplzGchSgU
It‚Äôs the autocracy for me. https://t.co/8UKHsZ5Z3P

Since I wrote this op-ed for @DataProgress last year‚Äîthen, as a candidate‚ÄîJustice Roberts has further gutted the Voting Rights Act by obliterating Section 2, striking down the eviction moratorium, and making it harder for working people to form unions. 

He is not your friend. https://t.co/i7lwWvCXO4
